text: The army is wreathed in a light mist to shield their movement and aid their attack.
The Fimir conjure swirling mists from which to trap their enemies.
Sets up a defensive camp, allowing for recruitment and replenishment, whilst raiding wealth from the local region.
Something higher pushes this force to its limits for now at least...
ME! ME! I SSSHALL BE RULER OF ALL FIMIR! THEN THE HU-MANSSS WILL FEAR USSS AGAIN! WE WILL RETAKE WHAT ISSS OURSSS! HELL-MOTHER SKATTACH SHALL RULE ALL!

The Tendrils of Doom are a fanatic sect of Fimir, dedicated to worshipping Kroll, the All-Mother, not as a Daemon Princess but as the one true Fimir goddess. They seek to make her apotheosis a reality, hoping they will be rewarded with rulership over the world when she turns it into a cursed bog for all eternity.
Work the slaves until they're near death and then sacrifice them.
With a great expenditure of slave lives, the Fimir can blanket a whole province in an impenetrable fog.
With a great expenditure of slave lives, the Fimir can blanket a whole province in an impenetrable fog.
In the bogs and swamps where the Fimir dwell, Kroll is spoken of in hushed tones.
Kroll makes her bid for godhood, and Fimir are there to do her bidding.
Continent-spanning, Fimir-built temples and blood sacrifices made within - all for their goddess, Kroll.
Kroll is now a Chaos God, and the Fimir are her blessed children.
In her quest for godhood, Kroll grants bonuses to her personal army and a diplomacy bonus with all Fimir.

In her quest for godhood Kroll gives bonuses to her personal army and can gain a diplomacy bonus with all Fimir.
Apotheosis of Kroll: God of the Depths
In her quest for godhood Kroll gives bonuses to her personal army and a diplomacy bonus with all Fimir.
With the intervention of the Gods, the usually docile Shearl are sent into a murderous rage.
Praise the Mud Father! His Swamp Daemon servants are now empowered with regeneration capabilities!
Passive ability: "Horrible Regeneration" for Swamp Daemons units
Weapon strength: %+n% for Swamp Daemons units
The Fimir can use their magical mist to channel the Winds of Magic, temporarily hide their armies, and offer extra protection against ranged units.

Fimir strongholds are seldom seen by outsiders, for they are wreathed in thick mist - a miasma magically conjured by the Fimir to shield their fortresses from prying eyes and themselves from the harsh glare of the sun.
The Mistwalkers are well trained to fight in the mist of Yvresse. Best to bring this advantage to every battlefield.
All you see in the eye of this cyclopean fiend is savagery - fitting that itâ€™s in a cage.
